items.q: A country’s cooking traditions are called its _____. a. history b. squash c. cuisine d. abundance
If something is diverse, it is _____. a. delicious b. varied c. expensive d. borrowed
The word game means _____. a. fish b. food c. animals d. puddings
If something is abundant, _____. a. it is very sweet b. it contains seafood c. there is a lot of it d. it is a native plant
Squash is a type of _____. a. stew b. plant c. animal d. seafood
There is a great _____ of cooking styles in the United States. a. diverse b. diversity c. divergent d. diverged
Television chefs are _____ in creating interest in new styles of cooking. a. influenced b. influences c. influence d. influential
Good cooks know just how much _____ to add to a dish. a. flavors b. flavoring c. flavored d. flavorful

In an essay that uses point-by-point organization, ____. a. the similarities are discussed in one paragraph but the differences are not discussed b. similarities and differences on the same point are discussed together c. different supporting ideas appear in all paragraphs d. contrast or comparison structure words are not used
If something is substantial, it is _____. a. delicious b. large c. hot d. expensive
A full breakfast doesn’t include _____. a. bacon b. eggs c. lemon juice d. tomatoes
Inevitably means _____. a. never b. sometimes c. usually d. always
If you skip a meal, you _____. a. don’t eat it b. enjoy it a lot c. share it with someone d. make it yourself
If you savor something, you _____. a. eat it quickly b. learn to cook it c. take time to enjoy it d. start the day with it
__________ are part of a continental breakfast . a. Egg dishes b. Pastries c. Cold meats d. Sausages
A vendor is someone who _____. a. loves food b. sells food c. buys food d. eats only vegetables
If a flavor is distinct, _____. a. it comes from a spice b. it isn’t very strong c. it is unpleasant d. it is different form other flavors
To be healthy, you should eat a _____ of different foods. a. vary b. varied c. various d. variety
I like my coffee _____ hot. a. suited b. suit c. suitable d. suitably
Blue cheese has a very _____ flavor. a. distinction b. distinctive c. distinguishing d. distinguish

The words while and whereas are used to show ____. a. that two things are the same b. that one thing is opposite of another c. that the first thing is more important than the other ones d. that two things are not related to each other
Which of the following words introduces a comparison? a. however b. likewise c. nevertheless d. while

Which sentence has the correct punctuation? a. While stews are popular in New England, they aren't as popular in the South. b. While, stews are popular in New England they aren't as popular in the South. c. While stews are popular, in New England, they aren't as popular in the South. d. While stews are popular in New England; they aren't as popular in the South.
In an essay that uses block organization, the similarities are discussed in one or more paragraphs and the differences are discussed in one or more paragraphs.
In an essay that uses point-by-point organization, different supporting points can be used for both sides.
Use the words whereas and while to discuss two similar things.
The words although or though introduce an adverbial clause that shows a contrast.
In point-by-point organization, the most important point must come first.
In block organization, comparison and contrast words are not necessary.
Corn was a native plant in the United States.
American cuisine is mainly hamburgers and hot dogs.
People in New England and in the South tend to like sweet foods.
A long, hard winter is needed to grow potatoes.
The Puritans in New England preferred plain foods.
Butternut squash is a staple food in the South.
Northern Europeans living in a cold climate favor a continental breakfast.
Russians eat sausages and eggs for breakfast.
Scandinavians drink coffee or hot chocolate with breakfast.
The continental breakfast is sweet.
Many Mexicans skip breakfast.
Central Americans enjoy a spicy breakfast.
The Chinese eat the same thing for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Some Japanese eat ham and eggs for breakfast.
The contrast word although can appear at the end of a sentence.
The words even though at the beginning of a sentence are followed by a comma.
In Chinese cooking, soy sauce is considered a staple at most meals. Americans just use soy sauce occasionally.
Most of the time, the Chinese serve rice in small bowls. Americans usually serve rice in a big bowl or on the main plate.
In general, the Chinese serve meat in small portions. Americans serve meat in large portions, such as steaks and hamburgers.
It is the custom for Americans to eat with a knife and a fork. Most of the time, the Chinese eat their food with chopsticks.
It is not common for American restaurants to serve duck. In Chinese cuisine, duck is often considered a special meal when families go out to eat.
